meanings.definition: To work less than is usual or necessary.
meanings.sent1: She tends to underwork on Mondays, feeling tired after the weekend.
meanings.sent2: I can't afford to underwork this week with all the deadlines approaching.
meanings.sent3: The lazy cat decided to underwork on catching mice today.
meanings.sent4: His car engine seemed to underwork, struggling to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The old clock underworked, ticking slowly and irregularly.

meanings.sent1: The chef would never underwork when preparing a special dish for the guests.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to underwork when studying for exams.
meanings.sent3: The robot underworked on its task, causing chaos in the factory.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm seemed to underwork, lacking the usual spark.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight underworked, barely illuminating the dark path ahead.
